translated: Record of the Three Treasures Through the Ages, Scroll 15
Table of Contents for the Record of the Three Treasures of the Kaihuang Era, Submitted to the Emperor
Minister Fang says: I have heard that those who have merit for the country have their achievements recorded in the history books. Those who govern the people
have their virtues inscribed in steles and biographies.
How much more so for the great sage Tathagata, whose transformative influence reaches the endless future, and is not without its beauty.
The fragrance flows for a hundred kings and a thousand years.
I, the minister, have secretly examined and read.
Since the Han and Wei dynasties, there have been translations.
But the catalog entries are scattered like stars, and many scriptures have lost their origins.
In the world, few have continued to cultivate, and the times have led to interruptions.
For this reason, the Buddha entrusted the true Dharma to the kings of countries.
It should be known that the rise of the teachings depends on the emperor.
I humbly think that Your Majesty, in accordance with the mandate of Heaven, holds the imperial seal.
You have received the Tathagata's prophecy.
You have inherited the Wheel-Turning King's industry.
You govern the JambudvÄ«pa continent.
You pity the world's confusion and open the wisdom sun to illuminate.
You extensively weave scriptures and images and greatly open the monasteries.
You proclaim the gate of liberation.
You guide the path of gods and humans.
Building a boat of goodness to rescue sentient beings.
This is truly a great event in the ages.
How dare I, a humble and insignificant person, rashly write about it?
But when the Dharma was destroyed in the past, I was still wearing dyed robes.
Today, when it is flourishing again, I am still participating in the monastic community.
I have been closely involved with the events and have heard about them.
Therefore, I have compiled the causes and conditions of the Buddha Dharma through the generations.
Starting from the birth of the Buddha in Ji Zhou Zhuang Wang Jia Wu in the Western Regions, to the Han Dynasty Emperor Ming's Yong Ping Ding Mao year when the sutras were transmitted to the East.
Up to the present Kai Huang Tai Sui Ding Si year.
It has been 1,274 years.
In between, there were spiritual auspicious signs, emperors, famous monks, and different eras.
It is clearly recorded in the Kai Huang San Bao Lu.
A total of 15 volumes.
I hope the Dharma will not be hidden and the sutras will be widely circulated.
I am overwhelmed with fear and trembling.ğŸ”½I rashly present this record to the court for your perusal.
I humbly hope that the emperor's compassion will descend and examine it carefully. Respectfully.

Preface to the Comprehensive Catalog of the Three Treasures of the Kaihuang Era, Preface to the Comprehensive Catalog of the Three Treasures of the Kaihuang Era, on the twenty-third day of the twelfth month in the seventeenth year of the Kaihuang era.

The humble one, Fei Changfang of Chengdu, a student of the Tripiá¹­aka in the Great Xingshan Temple, humbly thinks that the Three Treasures are the source of nourishment for the four kinds of birth, and the world has its periods of flourishing and decline.
This leads people to either rise or sink.
When flourishing, blessings and virtues always lead to rebirth in the heavens, as a wheel-turning king, or as a ruler of humans.
When declining, the retribution for offenses always results in rebirth in the hells, as a hungry ghost, or as an animal.
In discussing the depth of benefiting beings, nothing surpasses the Dharma.
Why is this? The Dharma is the mother of the Buddha, and the Buddha is born from the Dharma.
The TathÄgatas of the three times all make offerings to the Dharma.
Therefore, the ÅšrÄ«gupta-prajÃ±ÄpÄramitÄ-sÅ«tra says:
If one makes offerings to the Dharma, it is the same as making offerings to the Buddha.
This shows that the flowing of the Dharma teachings continues for myriad generations.
The Buddha and the Saá¹ƒgha open the way and guide, only benefiting for a time.
Therefore, in the eon of worthies, the thousand Buddhas share the same teaching.
The longevity and brevity of life, the four sages differ in their years.
Although they lived in the world for different lengths of time,
in promoting the Dharma there was no difference.ğŸ”½They all boiled the ocean of desire and saved sentient beings to enter nirvana.
They chiseled away the mountain of arrogance and liberated living beings to attain prajÃ±Ä.
However, prajÃ±Ä is profoundly still.
Without relying on sound, it is difficult to communicate.
Sound must rely on form.
Without relying on characteristics, it cannot be manifested.
Therefore, the realm is called the land of forbearance,
including a hundred koá¹­Ä«s of Sumerus.
The world is called Saha,
governing the lands of the trichiliocosm.
The defiled lands of the three realms and five turbidities are divided.
The shapes of the six destinies and two vehicles are distinct.
The Great Sage, out of compassion, descended to Kapilavastu.
The golden body of sixteen feet appeared in the royal palace.
The thirty-two marks illuminated the body of the prince.
At nineteen, he left home and at thirty, he attained enlightenment.
For forty-nine years, he remained in the world.
Using language and skillful means, he expounded extensively.
The Dharma of non-attachment was personally proclaimed by the Golden Mouth.
With one sound, it was expounded, and myriad kinds each understood.
The conditions and opportunities were not one, and the teachings were as numerous as dust motes.
Ä€nanda upheld it without losing a drop.
It was like pouring water from one vessel to another.
At the twin trees, he entered parinirvÄá¹‡a.
KÄÅ›yapa convened the council in the royal city.
One thousand arhats examined and recorded it in turn.
It was written on leaves and bark, spread throughout India.
The five hundred kingdoms all upheld it together.
The sixteen great kings all equally protected it.
At the beginning of the Later Han dynasty, it arrived in China.
The imperial eras spanned sixteen generations.
It translated the language of that region into the language of this land.
It has been passed down to the present for more than five hundred generations.
The ancient and old two records have incomplete entries.
Shi Sengyou and Dao'an initiated the filling of its gaps.
Since then, there have been different traditions.
Each records one region and preserves what they have seen.
The three corners are separated, so many doubts are lost.
Moreover, during the Qi, Zhou, and Chen dynasties, translations were all made.ğŸ”½The catalog was not revised, and no one followed it.
In addition, during the period of destruction and burning, there was no basis to rely on.
I am grateful that our emperor supports the earth and upholds the heavens.
He clarifies the two polarities and purifies the six directions.
The court receives myriad nations and transforms the nine provinces.
The remaining texts from different sources are all gathered.
I am fortunate to encounter this time of peace.
I am honored to participate in translating the scriptures and receive the Buddha's words.
When I have free time from writing, I dare not forget to eat and sleep.
For more than ten years,
I have inquired about the old and searched for them.
I have only recently found them.
Although I have roughly stitched them together, I am still worried that they are not complete.
I will extensively study and seek them, respectfully awaiting future talents.
What I have compiled now,
I have roughly followed the three books as a guide.
This reveals the Three Jewels.
The auspicious events of the Buddha's birth year rely on the Zhou dynasty's Night Luster.
The auspicious events of the time of the sutra's translation follow the Han dynasty's Night Dream.
The beginning of the monks, the ramparts and pillars,
The light of the Vinaya shines brightly, illuminating wisdom.
On the side, I have collected the records of reclusive years, national aspirations, ancient texts, and various historical records, totaling nearly several dozen works.
I have selected the essence from them to form this record.
Fanning it for a thousand years, the wind will reach a hundred kings.
Together, we will hold the light of the torch of wisdom.
Illuminating the darkness of the times.
Together, we will transmit the nourishing moisture of the Dharma stream.
Satisfying the world's parched and withered state.
Proclaiming our imperial way, guiding and opening its beginning.
In the past, at the head of the compilation,
It was all said to be in a certain country or city.
Now, in the work of translation and propagation,
It is necessary to rely on each era.
Therefore, the structure of this record generally takes the name
And is called the Records of Han, Wei, Wu, and Great Sui.
Lost translations and suspected forgeries,
Rely on the old annotations of people,
Taking the year as the first.
The sÅ«tras are arranged according to their size.
There are those that are listed twice,
Still, they are generally divided by era, distinguishing the Chinese and foreign.
A total of 197 people, both monastic and lay, participated.
The scriptures, vinaya, precepts, treatises, and biographies they produced.ğŸ”½Totaling 2,146 texts.
In 6,235 fascicles.
Arranged into 15 scrolls.
One scroll is a general catalog.
Two scrolls are for entering the canon.
Three scrolls are for imperial years.
Nine scrolls are for chronological records.
The chronological records list the number of scriptures translated.
The imperial years show the distance in time since the Buddha's passing.
Entering the canon distinguishes the shallow and deep teachings of the lesser and greater vehicles.
In the past, when the tripod of King Wen appeared,
It indicated the prosperity of the Han dynasty.
Recently, when the Zhou dynasty destroyed it, the Dharma revived.
It shows the eternal peace of the great Sui dynasty.
The Buddha's sun shines again.
Beginning from the first year of the Great Xing era.
The sutras and treatises return to obscurity.
Starting from the first year of the Kaihuang era.
Events support principles and are in accord.
This is combined with the prosperous peace.ğŸ”½Describing the reasons for this.
Based on this, it is composed.
Therefore, the outer title is called the Kaihuang Record of the Three Treasures.
Within the scroll, it is distinguished as the Chronicle of Successive Dynasties.
